thread.title: Campus report: Freeport's Ellie Willging sets XC record for St. Xavier
thread.title_full: Campus report: Freeport's Ellie Willging sets XC record for St. Xavier

author: Dan Chamness Correspondent
title: Campus report: Freeport's Ellie Willging sets XC record for St. Xavier
text: Freeport graduate Ellie Willging was not aiming for the all-time 5,000-meter school record at Saint Xavier University. Her coach was. Saint Xavier coach Lisa Ebel said she was positive the school record would fall last Friday at the Bethel College Pilot Invitational. Ebel was so confident enough that she sent a text to the record holder, Rachael Dean, as the race started. Much as Ebel suspected, Willging dashed to the finish line in 17 minutes, 55.2 seconds. "Ellie ran 18:08 two weeks ago," Ebel said. "I knew if she had the right conditions and the right competition, the record was gone. Alex Berends of Taylor University gave Ellie the right amount of competition." The former record of 17:57 was set by Dean in 2010. Dean and Berends have both been named NAIA All-Americans. Berends won the race in 17:51.5. Willging, a sophomore, was second. As a team, SXU took third with 107 points. Taylor won with 24 points. "I just want to help this team advance to nationals," Willging said. "When I am running, I just concentrate on the race and how I can help the team. I don't think about the records. If they happen, that is great. If not, I just want to say I gave it my all." Chase Wilhelms (Eastland) and Nick Jensen (Orangeville) both started on the offensive line for Wartburg College as it downed Coe College 31-14. Jensen started at right tackle, while Wilhelms started at left guard. The Knights posted 482 yards of offense. They passed for 251 yards and rushed for 231 and had 27 first downs. Wartburg, ranked sixth among NCAA Division III teams, improved to 5-0 overall. — Jordan Blair (Eastland) had nine tackles (three solos) for Eureka College in a 26-18 loss to Westminster College. The senior defensive back was also in on a tackle for a 1-yard loss. Eureka has lost three in a row and is 2-4 overall and 1-4 in the Upper Midwest Athletic Conference. — Kristin Wright (Stockton) had 16 digs in University of Dubuque's 3-0 win over Rockford University. She also had three assists. In Dubuque's 3-2 win over Simpson College, Wright had 21 digs and two assists. Dubuque is 12-12 overall and 2-2 in the Iowa Intercollegiate Athletic Conference. — Marissa Plock (Forreston) had four kills in Rockford's loss toDubuque. Fellow Rockford players Amanda Korte (Dakota) and Liberty Hartman (Eastland) each had three kills. Korte had three digs, while Hartman hit .200. Rockford is 7-12 overall and 1-3 in the Northern Athletic Collegiate Conference. — Nolan Brannick (Aquin) caught three passes to help North Central College defeat North Park. North Central, ranked 17th in Division III, is 3-2 overall and 2-0 in the College Conference of Illinois and Wisconsin. — Austin Mancosky (Lena-Winslow) carried one time for 32 yards in Wisconsin-LaCrosse's 28-21 win over Wisconsin-Stout. Wisconsin-LaCrosse is 2-3 overall and 1-1 in the Wisconsin Intercollegiate Athletic Conference. Page 2 of 2 - — Peyton Achs (Eastland) had two digs in Augustana's 3-0 volleyball loss to Millikin. Augustana is 8-11 overall and 1-3 in the College Conference of Illinois and Wisconsin. — Scott Armstrong (Freeport) has played in nine soccer games for the Blackburn College Beavers. Armstrong, a junior defensive player, has one shot on goal. Blackburn is 4-6-2 overall and 1-2 in the St. Louis Intercollegiate Athletic Conference. — Mark Voreis (Lena-Winslow) has played in two games for Knox College and made two tackles. Knox is 2-3 overall and 0-1 in the Midwest Conference. By Dan Chamness
